prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** **Overview:** We will construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, having a slightly tapered body and a smooth surface, centered in the image. This part has one coordinate system, one sketch with two faces, and one extrusion with a NewBodyFeatureOperation. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system:** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0141, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch:** 1. Sketch face_1 with a single loop: a. Draw a circle with Center at [0.375, 0.375] and Radius of 0.375. 2. Sketch face_2 with a single loop: a. Draw an arc with Start Point at [0.0986, 0.6285], Mid Point at [0.1132, 0.6435], and End Point at [0.1286, 0.6576]. b. Draw a line starting from the End Point of the arc [0.1286, 0.6576] and ending at the Start Point of the arc [0.0986, 0.6576]. c. Draw another line starting from the Start Point of the arc [0.0986, 0.6576] and ending at the Start Point of the arc [0.0986, 0.6285]. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch:** Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch:** 1. Apply the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model:** Extrude the 2D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0141 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Combine with the existing bodies using a NewBodyFeatureOperation (join) After completing these steps, your parametric CAD model of the cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom will be built. The part has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0141 - Height: 0.75</description>

Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrude depth towards the normal should be set to 0.2148 and the extrude depth opposite normal should also be set to 0.2148. This will create a 3D model with a height of 0.2148 units.
